intro: Otatea ramirezii, commonly known as the Ramirez's otatea, is a species of flowering plant in the family Arecaceae, native to the tropical regions of South America. It is a small to medium-sized palm characterized by its pinnate leaves and clustered, small, yellowish-white flowers. The plant produces drupes that are typically reddish or black when mature, containing a single seed. Otatea ramirezii is often found in humid, lowland forests and is adapted to thrive in warm, moist environments. Its botanical features make it an important component of its native ecosystems.
